alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 1:47PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Delaware...southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in northern Delaware...New Castle. In southern New Jersey... Gloucester and Salem. In southeast Pennsylvania...Delaware and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 147 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Wilmington, Chester, West Deptford, Pennsville, Woodbury, Carneys Point, Folcroft, Elsmere, Paulsboro, New Castle, and Penns Grove. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 17. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 8 and 23. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 23. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 0. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
